newsitem.title: USA: WebTV in set-top box deal with UK's Pace Micro.
newsitem.headline: WebTV in set-top box deal with UK's Pace Micro.

text.p: WebTV Networks said Pace Micro Technology has signed an agreement to licence the WebTV reference design technology for enabling Internet services to be delivered over television sets.

WebTV said Pace, which was due to preview its Internet set-top box design at the Cable and Satellite '97 exhibition in London, will work with it to make the set-top box and trial service available before Christmas this year.
Pace, based in Shipley, West Yorkshire, manufactures satellite and cable receiver decoders. It will initially launch the its products with the WebTV service in Britain.
WebTV, which was founded in mid-1995, agreed to be acquired by software giant Microsoft Corp earlier this month in a deal worth about $425 million in stock and cash.
